citing_paper_authors: Linlin, Li | Caroline, Sporleder
raw_text: Canonicalforms are determined automatically using a statistical, frequency-based measure. Birke and Sarkar (2006) model literal vs. non literal classification as a word sense disambiguation task and use a clustering algorithm which compares test instances to two seed sets (one with literal and one with non-literal expressions), as signing the label of the closest set. Sporleder and Li (2009) propose another unsupervised method which detects the presence or absence of cohesive links between the component words of the idiom and the surrounding discourse. If such links can be found the expression is classified as literal otherwise as non-literal
